name: Oaks Waterfront Resort The Entrance

reviews.text: Stayed here for just one night but found the accommodation to be perfectly adequate. In terms of decor the room was quite basic but was well equipped for a self catering holiday with hotplate, fridge, washing machine etc. Our room was on the 6th floor and we had great views from the balcony. ONly downside was that the lift had been damaged by the recent storm so we had to walk up 6 flights of stairs to our room with 2 young children but it didn't really affect our stay. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Stayed at this 'resort' due to limited accommodation available at the time and won't be back. The very strong damp odour in the room made us feel sick and we were unable to open balcony door due to rain. The noise from the air conditioner was loud and annoying which impacted on it's use. We requested, and paid for, an additonal bed but this wasn't set up nor was the extra linen or towels. No tea/coffee/milk in room or hair dryer - when we contacted reception they wouldn't deliver - we had to go and collect. Due to torrential rain at the time of our stay most of the cafe/restaurants in the vacinity weren't accessable or open which meant we were restricted to using the restaurant within hotel, what a disaster. The 'restaurant' is well below average - dirty with over priced meals and poor service.
reviews.title: Greatly Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one positive for this hotel is it's location - right in the heart of the main strip of The Entrance. But this isn't enough for us to return.
reviews.title: Great location but I wouldn't call this hotel a resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an ocean view room on the 1st floor which also had a balcony, the room was comfortable, but a little run down. Our room had a washing machine and dryer, so this was good as our room did not get serviced, so we had to wash and dry our towels as fresh towels were not given. We were expecting our rooms to be serviced when we went out all day, but came back to see it had not been serviced at all.
reviews.title: Great location in the heart of The Entrance

reviews.text: The swimming pool is heated all year round, so during our stay we did not use the pool as we did not like the warm feeling of it in summer. This would be a great thing if it was winter.
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: 1st let me say that Perfect Shirt Breaks deals are not worth a dollar.
reviews.title: Not even 4 zeros-Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2nd, Oaks Waterfront Resort, is not even 1 star. I have stayed in motels that have better cleaning and furniture.
reviews.title: Great views and location

reviews.text: Customer service is excellent, same goes to the location, but that is about all you would like there. Apartments are small, hallways smell like mould, carpet is too old, sofa is disgusting with marks, curtains are stained and have never been washed, toilets are outdated, kitchen is tiny and old, the balcony is dirty and spider webs everywhere... What else can you say?
reviews.title: Hate the room, too small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I bet that management had never stepped foot in Apartment 425, and I have no idea how they would make it available for guests.
reviews.title: Great location
Great Accomodation
reviews.text: We booked 3 nights, but managed to sleep there only 2. I didn't use the resorts' parking, no need, since council parking few meters away for free with unlimited parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent position, in the heart of the Entrance, with shops, restaurants, bars and pubs nearby. The rooms are clean, modern and very well equipped - we had a 1br apartment, it had a refrigerator, cook top, all utensils, tea and coffee making facilities, etc. However, be warned, the beds in the 1br apartments are rather small!! To our surprise, the rooms are NOT serviced daily! Internet prices are exorbitant. The pool/spa area is nice, but completely unsupervised and not very pleasant when kids are running wild. also, there are not enough sunbeds. Reception staff are not terribly friendly, and somewhat unkempt...
reviews.title: Nice rooms, so-so service...

reviews.text: I loved the position of the resort right on the lake, with heaps of things to do for the kids on your doorstep. I didn't much like to pay $15 for parking per night when there's free council parking opposite oaks park station.
reviews.title: Information about the hotel,sights and things to do in the area!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I would have liked was an information book about the hotel, like what time for check out and extra costs which I only found out when arriving, sights and things to do and see and also what's around us. I have an app on my phone called "around me"... That told me ATM's, cafes, pubs etc. for someone like me who has never been here before it would have been nice for some information.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely be returning. Had a great time. And the people on reception were helpful also!
reviews.title: Great time!

reviews.text: Stayed in a ocean view studio room we loved it.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: The Oaks is in a very nice location close to the sea. Had an ocean view room. The room was very old and showed it's age everywhere: worn down carpets, dirt spots aso. Air conditioner did not work. Complaint to reception and promised they will inform maintenance. But nothing happened for 4 days. Not worth he money I have paid for. Renovation is going on since 2010!!! How long can it take to get the job done?? Would choose another hotel when traveling into this area. Can only agree on previous reviews about the condition of the hotel.
reviews.title: Showed its age

reviews.text: Have stayed here 4 times, I just love the location & what The Entrance has to offer. We stayed from 24th January for 4 nights, in a one bedroom water view. The view was lovely from the balcony apart from the fact that we were in Room 105, which as it was over the awning at the front of the hotel had a ledge in front of the balcony that was coverered in pebbles & also a whole lot of rubbish that was obviously thrown from balconies above. I rang reception and asked if the rubbish which consisted of poppa juices, cotton buds, those popper things with streamers which must have been there from NYE and other stuff, the girl said they were trying to get a contracter in to clean it up as their staff could not go out on the ledge as they did not have a proper harness.Ok, will live with it then, BUT then when we sitting outside having a drink a hairbrush comes from upstairs, then bread, chips, ok, ring reception & ask if they can ring the units above us & ask them to stop throwing their rubbish down, as then of course when it got dark the ledge was crawling with cockroaches enjoying the bread & other food out there. To make it worse , next thing a waterfall suddenly appears, as the woman above was wringing out her clothes onto our balcony. Well that was the last straw for me, rang reception again & asked for the manger & was told she would be in at 7.30am. So the next morning I spoke with her who just apologised!!! and said she would get someone to clean the area & spray it, which they did, so the next night even though there were cockroaches there were not as many crawling around out there, but we got another shower of water from above, which this time I let the woman above know what I thought and told here she had a bathroom to do that it.Apart from the balcony issue the room was clean & fullfilled all our needs.My other complaint is ( I dont usually complain but for what I paid I expected to enjoy my 4 nights) was the lack of respect other guests have at this time of the year. The pool area needs to be supervised. There were grown men bombing & doing sommersaults in the pool with no regard to other guests. The pool area in the afternoon was disgusting, food & rubbish just thrown on the ground. I never used the spa , it states children under 6 not allowed in the spa, but everyday it was full of babies with nappies on, no babies I saw had the proper swim pants that they should wear when using public pool areas,so I hate to think what could have been under all that foam, and the Gym area states no children under 16, well there were kids running from the pool soaking wet having great fun on the treadmill & other machines in there.Oaks you really need a staff member up at the pool area.I will say the staff were friendy , but not very helpful.Also do not stay in Room 105 for the above reasons, though we had a fantatic view of the Australia Day fireworks from our balcony. Not sure If I will come & stay again, maybe time to look for somewhere new
reviews.title: 4 Nights and a few problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a studio apartment 117 for 3 nights and 2 days. The location to downtown The Entrance was good as we were able to go for walks and experience the Australia day festivities. However, I knew there was something wrong about this hotel when checked in. The staff at the reception desk seemed to be friendly. However, when checking in, we were disrupted by other people staying in making enquiries, resulting in the checking in process much longer. Our paperwork advised that we would have two swipe cards to get to our studio apartment/room however, we only received one.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: Our beds: as a couple, the hotel offered two single beds pushed together. Making this uncomfortable to sleep with a gap in the middle.
reviews.title: Never Again! Worst value for money I have ever encountered!

reviews.text: We were advised that the apartment would be unserviced, which would be fine for us. However, we found mould in the corner of the apartment hidden by the couch and also a cockroach and a condom wrapper under the tv unit. My partner also stepped on some broken glass that had been stuck in the carpet. The carpet was also damp on arrival, most likely due to the previous tenants ...
reviews.title: Good location

aka: Oaks Waterfront Resort The Entrance Hotel
description: Oaks Waterfront Resort idyllically located at the water’s edge, provides a wonderful escape destination for couples, families or groups with superb views of the stunning surf beach and Tuggerah Lake. Ideal for relaxed holidays and weekends away, Oaks Waterfront Resort offers a choice of studio, one and two bedroom luxury loft apartments and executive, spacious one and two bedroom fully self contained apartments, most with expansive views.
